channel.title: What's the best source to use?
channel.description:
Hey everyone! So far, I've been getting helped a lot, and posting a lot...For help. :|
But, I want to know your opinions,
What's best source to use for...People like me who are not that great with coding, but I can do decent ones.
Why I posted this, it's because I've posted a lot of "Releases" of "Great" RSPS sources, but so far, they all are not good! I keep rushing, but this time I need a source I can work with. Make it like runescape, sort of, break logs with woodcutting, ECT.
I'm going to try to make this a project, goal, achievement, for me. If you are going to flame, you may, but I hope no one does...But, other than that, thanks everyone for this great help! :)

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @RebirthScape RebirthScape
item.description:
@RebirthScape wrote:

Jake2008:

You won’t find any good sources out there that arn’t riddled with glitches and missing content. You just have to pick one and stick with it.

That’s true. Before, I would take hours and hours trying to search for a good and non glitchy one…Then I released, that’s spoonfeeding basically. But, yeah. Now, I’m trying to find a good one, only. Time to fix some glitches.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @RebirthScape RebirthScape
item.description:
@RebirthScape wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:10, topic:449458”]i would recommend you hyperion or shard, but it uses a more advanced concept of java
you could start with pi, that i dont like after all, or delta cleaned.[/quote]

Thank you too, sir.

You’ve all been a help!

Read full topic

i would recommend you hyperion or shard, but it uses a more advanced concept of java

item.source: What's the best source to use?

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“RebirthScape, post:8, topic:449458”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=552356.msg4046869#msg4046869 date=1342154378]
Both Hyperion and Azure are documented quite well… Of course if you count a tutorial as documentation then that’s why you see so little for it…
[/quote]

Well see, you can call me a leecher, mainly because I download many sources, I do not know which one to choose, it’s why I made this thread. I don’t know about Azure or Hyperion, think I’ve seen one Hyperion…[/quote]
Try and find a semi blank PI I guess from what you have said. Then program skills, minigames, ect and fix any glitches. Try not to rely on tutorials.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @Jake2008 Jake2008
item.description:
@Jake2008 wrote:

Jmood:

Both Hyperion and Azure are documented quite well… Of course if you count a tutorial as documentation then that’s why you see so little for it…

I guess documentation was the wrong word to use. but tutorials/help u wont find, because the good people who work with these sources wont stop to help newbies who cant open a shop.

Read full topic

item.source: What's the best source to use?

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @RebirthScape RebirthScape
item.description:
@RebirthScape wrote:

[quote=“Jake2008, post:4, topic:449458”]Look at your end goal, and then find a source that works with the client version you are aiming to make.

If you are trying to make a server with all the new stuff, polypores ect then you want to find some sort of 600/700+ client release, you wont be able to make a good server using a 317 like most people use.

However I would personally pick a project insanity source, just because the ammount of tutorials out there is huge. If you look at them then maybe you can learn what they are doing and a little more about how servers work.

Lets face it, you’re not going to get anywhere if you pick up a Hyperion or Azure with little guides/documentation and start trying to work on it.[/quote]

That’s very true! I like PI now, learning the commands are different, and everything.

I wish I could rep…Thanks a lot. Will try this.

Read full topic
item.source: What's the best source to use?

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @Jake2008 Jake2008
item.description:
@Jake2008 wrote:

Look at your end goal, and then find a source that works with the client version you are aiming to make.

If you are trying to make a server with all the new stuff, polypores ect then you want to find some sort of 600/700+ client release, you wont be able to make a good server using a 317 like most people use.

However I would personally pick a project insanity source, just because the ammount of tutorials out there is huge. If you look at them then maybe you can learn what they are doing and a little more about how servers work.

Lets face it, you’re not going to get anywhere if you pick up a Hyperion or Azure with little guides/documentation and start trying to work on it.

Read full topic
item.source: What's the best source to use?

item.title: What's the best source to use?
item.dc:creator: @RebirthScape RebirthScape
item.description:
@RebirthScape wrote:

Cruel Hand:

I would definitely try delta or PI

Well, I don’t want to act as if I’m wanting to be spoonfeeded, or being harsh, but I meant source not base.

But, yeah. I’m trying to find something…Thanks for replying.

Read full topic
